channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024121089
item.description:
Report X-2024121089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: MANHATTAN
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SIXTY-SIX (66) AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THE OUTER BOXES HAVE GREEN REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL STICKERS APPLIED AND ARE PREPRINTED TEMPERATURE SENSTIVE PRODUCT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES AROUND THE USA. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024120366
item.description:
Report E-2024120366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An employee was unloading drums from a truck at Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Kansas City. As the employee was entering the truck on the forklift, the portable dock plate unexpectedly shifted, pushing the forklift forward quicker than expected resulting in the forks of the forklift to puncture the side of a drum containing hazardous waste (waste flammable liquids - Methyl Ethyl Ketone, Benzene). Less than a gallon of the material was spilled in the trailer, fully contained, and no further releases occurred. The spilled material was cleaned up appropriately and the punctured drum was overpacked.

item.title: Report X-2024121018
item.description:
Report X-2024121018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: MANHATTAN
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO INSPECT APPROXIMATELY FIFTY-SIX AIR PACKAGES THAT FELT EXTREMELY COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FOOD. OUTER BOXES HAVE GREEN REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL STICKERS APPLIED AND ARE PREPRINTED TEMPERATURE SENSITIVE PRODUCT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES AROUND THE USA. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024120355
item.description:
Report E-2024120355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0242 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XWK. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Desert Tan 430 Urethane Part A was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to the pallet broke and the pail was forked by XWK. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 34. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Chelsea. Report #2024112100016. 20-gallon metal drum contains a 5-gallon metal pail of Desert Tan 430 Urethane Part A and oil dri.
